intro: Swertia wardii var. rigida, commonly known as the rigid swertia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. This variant is distinguished by its more rigid and upright growth habit compared to other varieties of Swertia wardii.
